form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Whitehouse introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To include community partners and intermediaries in the planning and delivery of education and related programs, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Community Partnerships in Education Act.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
TITLE I—Amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
Sec. 105. Academic assessment and local educational agency and school improvement.
TITLE II—Amendments to the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006
Sec. 203. Inclusion of community partners and intermediary organizations in State and local plans.
TITLE III—Amendments to the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act
Sec. 302. Inclusion of community partners and intermediary organizations in local workforce development boards and activities.
Sec. 303. Inclusion of community partners and intermediary organizations in adult education and literacy programs.
TITLE IV—Amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965
Sec. 404. Maintenance and expansion of existing programs.

title.header: Amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965

section.text: Section 481 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1088) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsections:

subsection.text: For purposes of this title, the term community partner means a nonprofit or public organization that has expertise in the planning and delivery of education and related programs, in forging coordination and cooperation between educators and educational institutions with other members of the community, or in training educators and other deliverers of educational services.

For purposes of this title, the term intermediary organization means a nonprofit organization that has expertise in training, forging public-private partnerships, systems development, capacity-building, improving scalability, evaluation, and development and implementation of data systems that measure the progress of students, schools and other educational institutions, and programs.
